properties.sfomuseum:description: Airmail flight cover, part of International Tributes to the History of Flight series by the Postal Commemorative Society; white envelope with full color illustration cachet and inset stamp commemorating first nonstop transatlantic flight on June 14, 1919, in St. John’s, Newfoundland, by Captain John Alcock and Lieutenant Arthur Whitten Brown with Vickers-Vimy biplane; commemorative cancellation stamp dated June 14, 1984 in St. John’s; includes information on reverse.
properties.wof:name: airmail flight cover: First nonstop transatlantic flight commemorative
